reviews.review_msg: He's knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and relatively easygoing. Offers helpful advice in and outside of class. Adapts the course as needed. Not so great at responding to emails in a timely manner, but still the best professor I had at SFU.

good guy, but didn't really teach at all. classes consisted of discussing tech news, talking a bit about our online discussions, and then each week a group presented on their tech topic. His key takeaways from the course were essentially to read the news and develop your skills. Was pretty easy though as the exam was open book.

Mike is a likeable guy and decent for his first semester at SFU. He encourages fruitful discussion and is approachable. However, his expectations were often unclear and communication was inconsistent; I'm sure he'll hash this out later on. Getting started early on the group project, participation, and thorough citations / referencing are key

Drew is a really good prof. Go to class and participate as it's worth a decent amount of your grade. Final Exam is just based off of the student presentations. Really easy class and not much work required.

This class was fantastic! Drew was an exceptional prof, but sadly he only lectured for the first five weeks, because the rest of the course is spent presenting and listening to everyone's presentation. However, each presentation topic was engaging and very informative. If you put in the effort, participate, and go to class, you will do very well!
Best professor at SFU. Enough said.

One of the best profs I've had at SFU, Drew's class made me excited to learn again. Not the usual boring lecture style. Interactive, student-driven discussions about things relevant to our lives and careers provide a platform to never be bored. Extremely clear expectations for the final and project writeup, very fair marking.
Drew was a great prof. Extremely caring for his students and always engaging and motivating students! Definitely take this course if you're able to.

Drew was a very open-minded prof and was always very engaged and interested in the group technology presentations. Learned a lot in this class - it has been the best and most fun class I've ever taken at SFU.

Drew really cares about his students, and loves student feedback in class. This class is how a 400 level class should be! Fun, engaging, and empowers students to learn about the technology around them.
Drew's class is a lot of fun and extremely engaging! You'll never be bored and you're excited to get to class every day.

Drew is one of the best profs I've had at SFU! He's loads of fun and very engaging. (He also looks like Santa). Class is very unstructured and allows for very interesting discussions. Workload is minimum. Lots of freedom for term project. Term presentation is very casual. Final exam was really easy. Would take a class with Drew again for sure!
We were allowed to use our own laptops and the Internet for the final exam, as well as listening to your ipod! It's a very different course from the rest of the business classes!

He is very approachable and seems like a friend of us. He is very open to new ideas and will not get offended if you disagree with him. Group project is one of the big portion for the mark and everyone gets about 8-9 out of 10. final exam is very interesting and he is very lenient in terms of marks. Highly suggested!
Never rated a prof before, but this guys is amazing and he deserves some recognition. Very interesting, helpful and easy going.

Quite possibly the best professor I have ever had in any school period. Very clear, very friendly and extremely approachable. Completely open to new ideas and trying things out. This course (BUS 466) was also designed mainly by him and it is an excellent course full of dialog, no memorizing and the final exam format fits the course perfectly.

Overall, a great prof. However, there are some issues with how he teaches this class. He tends to dominate discussion, as well as be TOO lenient on his students. Some changes should be made to the class to make it more challenging and force students to be critical.
One of the best profs ever.  Funny, easy-going and a very lenient marker.  This guy is awesome!

I was blown away at how amazing Drew made this course.  He is fun, easygoing, & a very lenient marker & lets the class go where the students take it (stay awake & participate even a little & you'll be fine).  Plus, there is no textbook to buy!  P.S.  The only technical thing to know:  to get on the Internet, you need a subnet, IP, DNS, & gateway!

Excellent Prof, great class ==> perfect combination. I enjoyed every minute of the class and actullay learned something about 'linux'. I would definitely get another class with him-if he offers though!
Great Prof. EXTREMELY helpful for all questions you ask. Be sure to read some news articles related to the course and he will remember you well.
Great guy, great class.  No matter what he says, this class is technically focused.  However, I would definately take another class with Drew (it's just hard for him to stay on topic sometimes!)
Compared to the other marketing profs, Adam was pretty good!
